0.user_question: Six years ago, when Noah was half as old as Cera, the population of Chile was half what it is now. Currently, Cera is 46 years old. If the population of Chile six years ago was 3000 times the age of Noah, calculate the population of Chile now.

ost_step.1: Six years ago, Cera was 46 - 6 = 40 years old.
ost_step.2: Noah was then half that age, so Noah was 40 / 2 = 20 years old at that time.
ost_step.3: Accordingly, if the population was 3000 times his age back then, we get the population from six years ago which equals 3000 * 20 = 60,000 people.
ost_step.4: As this figure represents only half of the current population due to growth over those past years, multiply by two for the present count: Current Population = 60,000 x 2 = 120,000 individuals currently residing in Chile according to these conditions.

direct_answer.text:
Let's break down the information provided into manageable parts before arriving at our solution. We know three main facts about ages and populations connected through mathematical operations (division/multiplication):

First Key Fact About Age Difference Between Noah & Cera Past Event (Event Occurred 'x' Years Ago) :   
Cera_Age_Past = Cera_Current_Age - TimeGap  
Noah_Age_Past = Cera_Age_Past / 2                       [Because Back At That Moment Of Events]    
TimeGap= 6
